definition: to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]

sentences.english: The ball he put over at the start of the second half at Hull was like Beckham in his prime.
sentences.chinese: 对赫尔城下半场刚开始他射进的入球像极了贝克汉姆。

sentences.english: It was Fabiano's third goal at this World Cup.
sentences.chinese: 这也是法比亚诺在本届世界杯的第3粒入球。

sentences.english: Diego Milito with a goal five minutes before half-time.
sentences.chinese: 迭戈米利托在半场结束五分钟前攻入了全场唯一入球。

sentences.english: He showed another string to his bow with a stunning goal at Chelsea.
sentences.chinese: 他在对战切尔西的时候，也打入了一个漂亮的入球。

sentences.english: The last two matches between these teams at the DW Stadium have finished goalless.
sentences.chinese: 这两支球队过去两次在DW球场交锋都没有入球产生。

sentences.english: Credit to Wrighty, they were unbelievable goals.
sentences.chinese: 说到赖特的入球，都是不可思议的入球。

sentences.english: Credit to Wrighty, they were unbelievable goals.
sentences.chinese: 说到赖特的入球，都是不可思议的入球。

sentences.english: Giggs almost delivered a second outstanding goal midway through a far more open second half.
sentences.chinese: 在下半场中段，吉格斯险些再次打入一粒精彩入球。

sentences.english: Fabiano's second goal, in the 50th minute, was one of the best so far in this month-long tournament.
sentences.chinese: 粒入球在第50分钟产生，为本次世界杯的最佳进球。

sentences.english: The Uruguay international scored one and assisted another during an all-action 90 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 乌拉圭国脚踢满了全场，奉上一粒入球以及一次助攻。

sentences.english: Most of the goals I have scored are down to the words of advice from Rodolfo.
sentences.chinese: 我攻入的大部分入球都得益于博雷尔的忠告。

sentences.english: But the goal which rounded off his hat-trick took the breath away.
sentences.chinese: 相比之下，令他上演帽子戏法的入球则令人窒息。

sentences.english: Nevertheless, it was Doncaster who fashioned the first real opening of the match on ten minutes.
sentences.chinese: 然而，看起来好象是唐卡斯特会先取得入球。

sentences.english: The Brazilian was the top scorer of the competition with 10 goals.
sentences.chinese: 巴西籍球星以10粒入球成为联赛最佳射手。

definition: hat trick (when one player scores three goals)
to burst or force open a door/to excommunicate sb (from the Roman Catholic Church)/to score a goal (in football, hockey etc)
to force entrance into/to score a goal (sport)
to equalize/to level the score/to pull back the advantage
(soccer, handball etc) to kick or shoot the ball towards the goal
(sports) to extend the duration of a game (due to stoppages)/(abbr. for 傷停補時|伤停补时[shang1 ting2 bu3 shi2]) injury time
